SENT.plain: A 24-year-old woman, with known antiphospholid antibodies (APS), presented with an acute myocardial infarction (AMI) that occurred three months after delivery
No risk factors for arteriosclerosis and no past history of arterial/venous thrombosis were noted
During pregnancy, aspirin prophylaxis was prescribed and followed by steroids after caesarian section
Steroids withdrawal was followed by AMI
Immediate coronary angiography revealed thrombotic occlusion of the left descending coronary artery; PTCA was successfully performed
She was discharged with an antiplatelet and anticoagulant regimen
No recurrent coronary event occurred during follow-up
